title: United Artists logo from 1919
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060550im_/http:/typophile.com/files/download_6666.jpg)

Actual typeface of similar font suggestions are much appreciated.
author: p8terbo

comments.content: Only a similar: **[Tierra Nueva Norte (Bold)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060550/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Various%20%2F%20FDI%20%28Commercial%29&ffam=TierraNuevaNorte%20-%20Bold&fid=cf76ce3e190acbbf5343f0cd0464a561&fsize=60&text=UNITED%20ARTISTS&wrap=2)** by Sebastian Nagel [FDI, 2010] (|U| & |A| are quite different)

The \_S\_ in Tierra Nueva is indeed rather close. [https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fdi/fdi-tierra-nueva/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060550/https:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/fdi/fdi-tierra-nueva/ "https://www.myfonts.com/fonts/fdi/fdi-tierra-nueva/")  
The flavor of this style of lettering is captured in some of the fonts from Greater Albion Typefounders [http://www.myfonts.com/foundry/Greater\_Albion\_Typefounders/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060550/http:/www.myfonts.com/foundry/Greater_Albion_Typefounders/ "http://www.myfonts.com/foundry/Greater\_Albion\_Typefounders/")  
Don

Saturday Morning Toast NF has the flavor

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060550im_/http:/typophile.com/files/SaturdayMorningToastNFAsUNITED_6145.gif)
  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/saturday-morning-toast/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060550/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/saturday-morning-toast/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/saturday-morning-toast/")  
This is a smoothed version of a font produced by American Type Founders as Curtis Post in 1902, which in turn was based on Post Oldstyle Roman No. 2. For a specimen see [http://luc.devroye.org/EJKitson-or-GuernseyMoore-or-HermannIhlenburg--Po...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060550/http:/luc.devroye.org/EJKitson-or-GuernseyMoore-or-HermannIhlenburg--PostOldstyleRomanNo2--1901.png "http://luc.devroye.org/EJKitson-or-GuernseyMoore-or-HermannIhlenburg--PostOldstyleRomanNo2--1901.png")  
Don
